column5: Solution Expert (f/m/d) for Data Analytics and Reporting
column6:
Major challenges in financial reporting are expected due to the migration and redesign of Siemens' ERP landscape to S/4 HANA, as well as the transition of the group reporting solution from SEM BCS to BCS/4 HANA. Therefore, we are seeking support in financial reporting from professionals who can design and implement innovative solutions in these areas.


**What we offer you**


- An attractive renumeration package

- Access to employee share plans

- 30 days of paid vacation and a variety of flexible work schedules that allow time off for you and your family

- 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard

- Flexible training opportunities for both your professional and personal development that you can tailor to your interests


Since each of over 300,000 employees feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information [here](https://www.siemens.com/de/en/company/jobs/benefits-what-we-offer.html).

The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, or corporate conditions.


**How you'll make an impact**

- You are the key architect for Reporting Solutions and therefore the main driver for envisioning designing, and implementing financial reporting solutions in the context of the Siemens-wide SAP BCS/ SAP BW/4 applications for group consolidation.

- Your focus is on the front end development mainly with SAP Tools like: Analysis for Office, SAC.

- You act as the main key contact person for the financial department for supporting them to fulfill their requirements regarding external and internal reporting according to HGB and IFRS regulations.

- You lead projects autonomous in the reporting area in strong collaboration with the financial department

- Contribute as solution architect and as part project lead to a new solution for group consolidation with a focus on the internal and external financial reporting topics (e.g., annual financial report).

- Constantly provide innovations to improve or enhance analytics related solutions and service offerings by using new reporting tools like  PowerBI or also utilizing the capabilities of artificial intelligence.

- You manage and coordinate external partners and communicate with various business stakeholders for the successful completion of projects  and changes in existing solutions.


**Your defining qualities**


- **Education**

- You have a university degree in IT or a Business insights related field.


- **Experience & Skills**

- More then 5  years of experience in leading projects in reporting area.

- You have many years of experience in analytics and reporting (SAP BW, SAP BW/4) with a focus on reporting tools (SAP AO, SAC).

- You have functional knowledge in finance and especially on the closing process (IFRS & HGB and respective reporting and disclosure requirements).

- Knowledge of HANA Studio (Eclipse) as well as other BI tools are valued.

- Knowledge of group reporting solutions such as SAP SEM BCS, BCS/4, or Group Reporting, and on SAP S/4 HANA are advantageous.

- Experience in working in an international team.


- **Ways of working**

- You have strong engineering and analytical skills.

- You have strong communication skills and a solid understanding of financial processes and disclosure procedures for closing, with a focus on a strong collaboration with our key stakeholders.


- **Languages**

- You are business fluent in English and German.


You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you!

Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Let’s get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an [equal-opportunity employer](https://www.siemens.com/de/de/unternehmen/jobs/arbeiten-bei-siemens/inklusion.html) we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.


**About us**

We empower our people to stay resilient and relevant in a constantly changing world. And we’re looking for individuals who are always seeking creative ways to grow and learn – people who want to make a real impact, both now and in the future. Does that sound like you? Then you’d be a great fit for our dynamic, international team.

[www.siemens.de/careers](http://www.siemens.com/de/en/company/jobs.html) – if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

[FAQ ](http://www.siemens.com/de/de/unternehmen/jobs/karrieren-entdecken.html) – if you need further information on the application process.

****

**A springboard for finance leaders of the future.** If you want to make a difference – make it with us.

We are a global technology powerhouse centered on the industries that form the backbone of economies – manufacturing, infrastructure, and transport. Our technology brings together the digital and physical worlds to benefit our customers, society, and the environment. Working with us, you will have the opportunity to contribute to a meaningful impact on society and human progress while developing personally and professionally.

**Your role will entail:**

- Three individually tailored assignments within 24 months in different finance functions across Siemens’ Operating Companies, Corporate Units, or Siemens Financial Services.

- High level of responsibility for complex tasks in day-to-day business and project work in international teams from day one.

- Exposure to innovative, complex topics and developing experience in various business model environments, including Software as a Service (SaaS).

- With a base at headquarters in Germany, at least one assignment will be in another country worldwide to experience our finance business from a global perspective.

- Intensive training to support the continuous development of Associates broadening their finance expertise and improving their leadership skills. One-on-one coaching from the Associate’s top-management mentor complements the development package.

- Network with other FEP associates, the FEP alumni, and the broader finance community in various get-togethers to expand contacts across our businesses and countries.


**Your profile:**

- Successful completion of an MBA degree, Ph.D., outstanding diploma, Master’s degree in Finance/Accounting, or equivalent qualification in a finance-based course of studies.

- Five to ten years work experience in a finance function (ideally before final graduation) and at least 1-2 years working experience abroad.

- Focus on digital transformation and growth mindset

- Strong analytical skills with professional experience, including a broad range of responsibilities in the finance domain, such as business planning, performance monitoring, financial modeling, data analytics, new business model development, business intelligence, and post-merger reviews.

- Business proficiency in English with strong communication skills and an influential personality.

- Strong dedication, outstanding leadership skills vision for leading change.

- Willing to work abroad and learn a new language.


#FinanceExcellenceProgram

column5: Senior IT Project Manager (f/m/d) for SAP Rollout Projects
column6:
Do you want to help create the future of healthcare? Our name, Siemens Healthineers, was selected to honor our people who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sounds interesting?

**Then come and join our team as** **Senior IT Project Manager (f/m/d) for SAP Rollout Projectstofurther drive digitization at Siemens Healthineers.**

****

**Choose the best place for your work** – Within the scope of this position, it is possible, in consultation with your manager, to work mobile (within Germany) up to an average volume of 60% of the respective working hours.


**Your tasks and responsibilities:**

- You plan and execute complex, global projects on your own responsibility, especially in the area of agile projects, based on coordinated business requirements in cooperation with the IT demand managers.

- You are accountable for the functional control of the internal project organization and the external partners as well as the organizational interfaces and dependencies of all involved IT service and business partners.

- You plan and manage larger project budgets and resources on your own responsibility.

- You are responsible for project communication, including coordination with the respective steering board and stakeholders at senior management level.

- Project reporting as well as risk, resource or change management are also part of your tasks.


To find out more about the specific business, have a look at [https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/products-services](https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/products-services)

****

**Your qualifications and experience:** ****

- You have a university degree in computer science or a comparable specialization.

- You have many years of experience in the management of larger projects and professional leadership of employees within the framework of international projects.

- You have very profound working experience in the ten knowledge areas of Project Management:  Team Operations Management, Scope, Schedule, Cost Management, Quality and Resource Management, Communications, Risk, Supplier/Vendor, and Stakeholder Management.

- You have solid know-how in agile project management and managing Scrum teams.

- You have in-depth knowledge in transformation and migration management, especially in the area of SAP ERP and S/4HANA, and have already lead SAP projects.

- Ideally, you know our SHS IT SAP landscape and have proven knowledge in global rollouts of SHS IT programs.


**Your attributes and skills:** ****

- You have a convincing appearance, very good communication and presentation skills, and experience in dealing with important stakeholders at senior management level and in international teams.

- You are fluent in spoken and written German and English.

- You have worked abroad or in global teams several times and bring along corresponding international experience.

- You work very independently, are very interested in working with new technologies and applying them within the digitalization of our company.

- Personally, you convince us with your ability to change, your analytical skills and your focus on results.

- You are mobile and work with colleagues at different locations (remote and on-site).


**Our team **

Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. 73,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services.

**Our culture:**

Our culture embraces different perspectives, open debate, and the will to challenge convention. Change is a constant aspect of our work. We aspire to lead the change in our industry rather than just react to it. That’s why we invite you to take on new challenges, test your ideas, and celebrate success. Check our Careers Site at [https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/de/careers](https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/de/careers)

Do you want to help create the future of healthcare? Our name, Siemens Healthineers, was selected to honor our people who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sounds interesting?

**Then come and join our team asSenior Expert (f/m/d) Non Conformance Cost (NCC).**

****

**Choose the best place for your work – Within the scope of this position, it is possible, in consultation with your manager, to work mobile (within Germany) up to an average volume of 60% of the respective working hours.** ****

****

**Your tasks and responsibilities:**

- You are responsible for global NCC management, coordinating reporting and actions to reduce Non-Conformance Costs (NCC) across regions and business areas/lines.

- Together with the NCC team, you set targets with Siemens Healthineers units, monitor progress, and proactively support target achievement.

- You lead a virtual, multicultural, and globally networked Siemens Healthineers NCC community and contribute to improving financial reporting and reducing NCCs.

- A key part of your role will be the independent delivery of workshops to drive improvement initiatives, particularly through the application of core Healthineers Performance System methodologies.

- You independently develop a comprehensive training concept for NCC management to best prepare the community for challenges and to strengthen their skills in a targeted manner.

- You have overall responsibility for the annual NCC conference, from planning and programme design to successful implementation.

- You proactively identify and implement improvement projects in the global quality organisation, NCC and product quality.


To find out more about the specific business, have a look at [https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/de/products-services](https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/de/products-services)

****

**Your qualifications and experience:**   ****

- You have a degree in engineering, business, or a similar discipline.

- You have many years of experience in managing and coordinating cross-functional projects.

- You have a sound theoretical and practical knowledge of business management, controlling, product quality and non-conformance cost (NCC) management.

- You have extensive experience of working in an international and multicultural environment.


**Your attributes and skills:** ****

- You can analyse complex structures and issues and to work systematically and in a structured manner.

- With your excellent communication and presentation skills in German and English, you can conduct training courses and workshops effectively and consult with international colleagues.

- You are willing to travel worldwide, with a maximum of 20% travel.

- Your working style is structured and goal-oriented, especially in international teams.

- You are motivated to continuously improve processes and are open to change.


**Our team **

Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. 73,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. We know that our business thrives only when our people thrive and unlock their full potential. That’s why you are always our top priority. Our global, diverse team is ready to support, challenge, and inspire you, helping you grow in countless ways. Together, we’ll embark on an exciting journey of discovery. Who knows where this path will lead? Join us and take an active role in shaping your future!


**What we offer you**


- 2 to 3 days of mobile working per week as a global standard

- Attractive remuneration package

- Development opportunities for both personal and professional growth

- 30 leave days and a variety of flexible working models that allow time off for yourself and your family.

- Share matching programs to become a shareholder of Siemens AG


Since each of over 300,000 employees feels that other benefits are particularly important, and we cannot list our entire benefit portfolio here, you can find more information [here](https://www.siemens.com/de/en/company/jobs/benefits-what-we-offer.html).

The individual benefits are subject to regulatory, contractual, or corporate conditions.


**How you’ll make a difference**

- Collaborate within an international team of data scientists and machine learning engineers with diverse backgrounds, utilizing AI methods to accelerate Siemens internal and external digitalization

- Design and implement enterprise-scale MLOps architectures for Siemens' global AI initiatives

- Lead the development of production-grade ML systems with a focus on scalability, maintainability, and reliability

- Architect and build reusable AI services that serve as foundation for multiple internal and external business applications and products

- Develop large-scale (multi-)agent frameworks and integrate them into existing AI platforms (e.g., SiemensGPT & Siemens Data Cloud)

- Drive the technical strategy for Generative AI implementations, including LLMOps pipelines and infrastructure

- Support large-scale projects such as SiemensGPT, Xcelerator, Industrial Copilot and other strategic GenAI initiatives

- Collaborate with cross-functional teams and our internal customers to translate business requirements into scalable technical solutions

- Guide projects from conception through production deployment, ensuring engineering best practices


**This is how you'll win us over**


- **Education**

- Advanced degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Data Science, Mathematics, Physics, or related technical field


- **Experience & Skills**

- 5+ years of hands-on experience building production ML systems at scale

- Deep expertise in MLOps practices, including CI/CD pipelines for ML models, model serving architectures, model monitoring and observability

- Strong software engineering background with expertise in API development and scalable re-usable architectures

- Proven experience with cloud-native ML development (Azure/AWS)

- Strong C# and Python proficiency plus other programming languages, such as SQL, Java, JavaScript, Angular or React


- **Additional Qualifications**

- Demonstrated experience with LLM deployment and optimization

- Track record of building scalable NLP solutions in production

- Expertise in version control systems (Git) and GitLab CI/CD

- Strong system design and software architecture skills

- Experience with Infrastructure-as-code tools (especially Terraform)


- **Languages**

- Fluency in German and English is required


You are much more than your qualifications, and we believe in the potential of every single candidate. We look forward to getting to know you!

Your individual personality and perspective are important to us. We create a working environment that reflects the diversity of the society and support you in your personal and professional development. Let’s get to know your authentic personality and create a better future together with us. As an [equal-opportunity employer](https://www.siemens.com/de/de/unternehmen/jobs/arbeiten-bei-siemens/inklusion.html) we are happy to consider applications from individuals with disabilities.

**About us**

[www.siemens.de/careers](http://www.siemens.com/de/en/company/jobs.html) – if you would like to find out more about jobs & careers at Siemens.

[FAQ ](http://www.siemens.com/de/de/unternehmen/jobs/karrieren-entdecken.html) – if you need further information on the application process.

**We are Siemens**

To solve the biggest challenges of our time, we need bright minds with the ambition to make the impossible possible. Siemens is your place to thrive, challenge the status quo, make a difference and grow in a team of innovators who share your passion for tech. Are you in?

We're hiring a Supply Chain Consultant to be based out of our office in Karlsruhe office to drive our supply chain consulting business.  Whether you graduated recently or you have gained industry experience, you'll play an integral part in an experienced, committed and well-coordinated consulting team. You will be active part of projects for the sustainable improvement of the supply chain of our renowned and internationally active customers and gain insights into many different industries. If you are genuinely interested in Supply Chain and wish to learn and develop every day then we'd love to hear from you!

**You'll create impact by:**

- Utilising your creativity to support the design of logistic systems for our customers and use our own software tools for this purpose

- Supporting analysis and evaluation of data, structures and processes within the supply chain of our customers is also part of your tasks

- Working independently and responsibly on individual subtasks within your project team and thus developing yourself as quickly as possible


**Your Success is grounded in:**

- **Degree**  - MA or equivalent (Industrial Engineering, IT or Business Management – focus on supply chain)

- **Analytical**  - analysing data, solving logistics problems using our tools, conceptual thinking as well as enthusiasm for solving complex tasks are strengths that will help you flourish in our team.

- **Collaboration**  - you have excellent communications (English and German), confident presentation skills (finding solutions to work with tools and presenting to customers and enjoy being part of a diverse team - we also appreciate the ability to work independently, accurately and with initiative

- **Curiosity -** about our innovative software solutions and interest in data-driven projects

- **Consulting -**  ability to confidently present technical details to non-technical customers is key to succeeding in this role. Experience in supply chain departments with respect to planning tasks or digitalization is also helpful.

- **Tools**  - Supply Chain Planning or Simulation tools knowledge and/or experience


**Join our Digital World**

A collection of over 377,000 minds building the future, one day at a time in over 200 countries. We're dedicated to equality, and we welcome applications that reflect the diversity of the communities we work in. All employment decisions at Siemens are based on qualifications, merit, and business need. Bring your curiosity and creativity and help us Transform the every day!

We value equal opportunities and welcome applications from [people with disabilities](https://www.siemens.com/de/en/company/jobs/life-at-siemens/inclusion.html).

Siemens is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees. We will ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment. Please contact us to request accommodation.

If you believe in technology with purpose and are interested in learning more about Siemens Digital Industries Software before you apply then check out our [Mission / Vision and our software portfolio](https://www.sw.siemens.com/), [meet the team](https://eur01.safelinks.protection.outlook.com/?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.youtube.com%2Fwatch%3Fv%3Dk6mVLaUyO4U&data=05%7C02%7Cmarc.hamilton%40siemens.com%7Ca4440eda4ae342f00b9108dc12cc1521%7C38ae3bcd95794fd4addab42e1495d55a%7C1%7C0%7C638405914999056092%7CUnknown%7CTWFpbGZsb3d8eyJWIjoiMC4wLjAwMDAiLCJQIjoiV2luMzIiLCJBTiI6Ik1haWwiLCJXVCI6Mn0%3D%7C3000%7C%7C%7C&sdata=EM5IZBCW95iz1mM0iW47x0rawmhCDrjDGPyLeQYLYUc%3D&reserved=0) and join our Talent Community today so that we can stay connected in the areas that interest you: [www.siemens.com/careers/transformtheeveryday](https://www.sw.siemens.com/en-US/careers/)/

column5: Head (f/m/d) of Export Controls and Customs Strategy & Review
column6:
Do you want to help create the future of healthcare? Our name, Siemens Healthineers, was selected to honor our people who dedicate their energy and passion to this cause. It reflects their pioneering spirit combined with our long history of engineering in the ever-evolving healthcare industry.

We offer you a flexible and dynamic environment with opportunities to go beyond your comfort zone in order to grow personally and professionally. Sounds interesting?

****

**Then come and join our team * **as Head (f/m/d) of Export Controls and Customs Strategy & Review and contribute to the future success of the business with distinctive analysis and monitoring skills.**

****

**Choose the best place for your work –** Within the scope of this position, it is possible, in consultation with your manager, to work mobile (within Germany) up to an average volume of 60% of the respective working hours.****


This position can be based either in Erlangen, Germany or internationally, as long as the location is within a maximum of 6 time zones from Erlangen (CET).

**Your tasks and responsibilities:**

- You define the Export Control and Customs (ECC) strategy, review policies, processes and procedures on a global level, including full exploitation of opportunities under local ECC regulations.

- You ensure the effective implementation of the global ECC strategy and compliance with legal requirements, securing full adherence to organizational and control responsibilities across all ECC departments globally.

- You develop plans and solutions to ensure ECC compliance and process optimization.

- You actively contribute to global cross learning activities, global efficiency improvements and global levelling of risk management schemes.

- You develop, deploy and manage all applicable trade compliance processes and procedures globally, ensuring close alignment with related subject matter fields internally, as well as externally.

- You maintain formal engagement and provide leadership to deploy trade standards globally.

- You are responsible for the overall direction, coordination, and evaluation of trade compliance and risk management.

- You drive the development of tools and automation and provide a continuously updated framework for all processes and controls.

- You lead global training and communication efforts while coordinating regional and local initiatives to ensure alignment and consistency.

- You lead a team of 4 ECC Professionals.

- You monitor and review ECC Data Privacy deployment and implementation.


To find out more about the specific business, have a look at [https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/products-services](https://www.siemens-healthineers.com/products-services)

****

**Your qualifications and experience:** ****

- You hold a degree in Business Administration, Trade or Law.

- You have several years of substantial experience in Export Control and Customs and ideally in audit or review functions.

- You have several years of leadership experience with a diverse and team 

- You have strong IT affinity, demonstrated through solid knowledge of SAP, data analytics, and contemporary IT applications.

- You are experienced in project management (e.g. reviews, spot checks, other strategic projects).


**Your attributes and skills:** ****

- You are highly motivated and have a strong passion for solution- and result-oriented work.

- You possess strong analytical, methodical and problem-solving skills.

- You have a good understanding of business processes and are inspired by new and innovative projects in the ECC field.

- You act as an independent thinker with the confidence and presence to represent trade compliance in management reviews and challenge the status quo within the ECC framework.

- You design functional organizational structures, shape interfaces between teams and units as strictly or flexibly as required and establish effective communication and collaboration mechanisms across a large number of teams.

- You exhibit strong leadership and foster collaboration across all organizational levels, while maintaining a high level of self-motivation.

- You enjoy working in a team and are fluent in English. Knowledge of German is an advantage.


**Our team **

Siemens Healthineers is a leading global medical technology company. 73,000 dedicated colleagues in over 70 countries are driven to shape the future of healthcare. An estimated 5 million patients across the globe benefit every day from our innovative technologies and services in the areas of diagnostic and therapeutic imaging, laboratory diagnostics and molecular medicine, as well as digital health and enterprise services.

Our culture embraces different perspectives, open debate, and the will to challenge convention. Change is a constant aspect of our work. Siemens Healthineers Germany was awarded the Great Place to Work® certificate.

**Gemeinsam machen wir den Unterschied**

**Siemens Mobility**  ist ein eigenständig geführtes Unternehmen der Siemens AG und seit über 160 Jahren ein führender Anbieter im Bereich Mobilität. Zu unserem Kerngeschäft gehören Schienenfahrzeuge, Bahnautomatisierungs- und Elektrifizierungslösungen, schlüsselfertige Systeme sowie die dazugehörigen Serviceleistungen. Wir waren schon immer sehr innovativ, um Reisen schneller, sicherer und komfortabler zu machen. Heute brauchen wir neue Lösungen für neue Herausforderungen wie den Klimawandel und weltweit steigende Bevölkerungszahlen. Das ist es, was uns antreibt. Deshalb gestalten wir Mobilität mit Leidenschaft und sind immer einen Schritt voraus. Durch Digitalisierung machen wir Infrastrukturen intelligent und schaffen Möglichkeiten, die uns nachhaltig und nahtlos von A nach B bringen. Unsere über 40.000 Mitarbeitende sind Pioniere im Mobilitätswesen, die dabei helfen, die Welt in Bewegung zu halten.

Railigent X ist die offene IoT-Plattform von Siemens Mobility, die KI und Big Data nutzt, um das Asset Management im Schienenverkehr zu verändern. Unser Ziel? Die Verfügbarkeit zu erhöhen, die Gesamtbetriebskosten zu senken und die Wartung durch intelligente Datennutzung zu optimieren. Als Senior Data Platform Engineer sind Sie Teil eines agilen Softwareentwicklungsteams und spielen eine wichtige technische Rolle bei der Gestaltung des Railigent X Data Lake und seiner Ingestion Pipelines.

**Was tragen Sie bei?**

- Sie sind für Weiterentwicklung und zuverlässigen Betrieb von unseren Digitalen Services Connectivity und IoT in Railigent X für Schienenfahrzeuge zuständig.

- Zu Ihren Aufgaben gehört darüber hinaus die Weiterentwicklung und Optimierung des Betriebs der zentralen Digitalisierungsplattform im Hinblick auf Systemverfügbarkeit, -performance und Kosten.

- Sie verantworten und koordinieren das Deployment und die Aktualisierung unserer Services.

- Sie sind verantwortlich für die Konzeption und für die Kostenabschätzungen neuer Services, sowohl was die Infrastruktur als auch was die Operations Betreuung angeht.

- Sie arbeiten eng zusammen in interdisziplinären Teams und mit anderen DevOps-Teams zur Umsetzung und Lösungsfindungen bei komplexen Problemen, insbesondere auch mit anderen Engineering Organisationen, Projekte und Kunden.


**Was bringen Sie mit?**

- Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich absolviertes Masterstudium der Fachrichtung Informatik oder gleichwertig mit mehrjähriger Berufserfahrung im IT-Bereich.

- Sie haben mehrjährige DevOps Erfahrung bei der Weiterentwicklung und dem Betrieb von heterogenen IT-Systemen sowie bei der Problemlösung und Kundenbetreuung solcher Systeme (Linux, Python, Client-Server, VPN).

- Fundierte Kenntnisse in Cloud-Technologien (bevorzugt AWS), Container-Orchestrierung (z.B. Kubernetes), CI/CD-Pipelines und Automatisierungstools bringen Sie mit.

- Wünschenswert sind darüber hinaus Kenntnisse in Monitoring/Logging (Prometheus, Grafana, CloudWatch), Site Reliability Engineering, Security (ISO27001).

- Deutsch und Englisch beherrschen Sie verhandlungssicher in Wort und Schrift.

- Persönlich überzeugen Sie uns durch ein hohes Maß an Initiative, Team- und Kommunikationsfähigkeit sowie Ihr stark ausgeprägtes qualitäts- und kundenorientiertes Arbeiten in SAFe- oder Scrum-basierten Umgebungen.


**Was bieten wir Ihnen?**

Vereinbarkeit von Familie und Beruf

Mit einem zusätzlichen Betreuungszuschuss unterstützen wir Sie dabei, sich voll und ganz auf Ihre Karriere zu konzentrieren, ohne die Anforderungen Ihres Familienlebens aus den Augen zu verlieren.

Mobiles Arbeiten /Remote Working

Bei uns haben Sie die Möglichkeit, hybrid zu arbeiten. Das bedeutet, dass Sie zu einem erheblichen Anteil mobil tätig sein können. Dies haben wir durch eine Betriebsvereinbarung offiziell geregelt.

Inklusion & Vielfalt

Bei Siemens Mobility setzen wir uns gegen Ungerechtigkeit und Ungleichheit ein. Bei uns finden Sie ein Umfeld vor, in dem Sie Sie selbst sein können und dazugehören.

Eine Übersicht über unsere Benefits finden Sie [hier](https://new.siemens.com/de/de/unternehmen/jobs/benefits-was-wir-bieten.html).

**Wie treten Sie mit uns in Kontakt?**

**www.siemens.de/mobility**
wenn Sie vor Ihrer Bewerbung mehr über Siemens erfahren möchten.
[www.siemens.com/de/de/unternehmen/jobs/faq.html](http://www.siemens.com/de/de/unternehmen/jobs/faq.html)
wenn Sie Informationen rund um das Thema Bewerbung mittels unseres FAQ’s einholen möchten.
**+49 (9131) 17 5243-0**
wenn Sie über unsere Bewerberhotline weitere Fragen zur Stelle klären möchten.
[**www.siemens.com/mobility-jobs** ](http://www.siemens.com/mobility-jobs)
wenn Sie mehr Informationen zu Jobs & Karriere bei Siemens erhalten möchten.

Wir legen Wert auf Chancengleichheit und freuen uns über [Bewerbungen von Menschen mit Behinderung](https://www.siemens.com/de/de/home/unternehmen/jobs/arbeiten-bei-siemens/jobs-ohne-barrieren.html).

Ansprechpartnerin für diese Stellenausschreibung ist Frau Veronika Windmaier.

column5: Senior Account-Based und Demand Generation Marketing Manager (m/w/d)
column6:
Willkommen bei Bosch
            Bei Bosch gestalten wir Zukunft mit hochwertigen Technologien und Dienstleistungen, die Begeisterung wecken und das Leben der Menschen verbessern. Unser Versprechen an unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter steht dabei felsenfest: Wir wachsen gemeinsam, haben Freude an unserer Arbeit und inspirieren uns gegenseitig. Willkommen bei Bosch.
Die Bosch Global Software Technologies GmbH freut sich auf eine Bewerbung!

            Job Description
            As the Senior Account-Based undamp; Demand Generation Marketing Manager you will take full ownership of designing, implementing, and optimizing ABM undamp; lead generation strategies to drive engagement with high-value accounts and attract new lead to generate measurable business outcomes. Reporting directly to the Head of Marketing and Communications Europe, you will ensure that all activities are closely aligned with the overall portfolio and business objectives.
 Your primary focus will be on developing targeted, persona-driven marketing approaches, leveraging data and insights to optimize performance, and managing end-to-end campaign execution across digital, social, and offline channels. This role is pivotal in shaping the organization’s ABM and demand generation strategy, ensuring that marketing efforts effectively resonate with key customer segments and contribute directly to revenue growth.
 
Key Responsibilities
 
 ABM undamp; Demand Generation Strategy Development:
 • Develop and execute a highly customized ABM and demand generation strategy, ensuring that each campaign is tailored to specific customer pain points and business needs.
 • Work hand in hand with Sales, acting as a strategic partner to identify key accounts, understand their challenges, and co-create targeted marketing initiatives.
 • Regularly exchange insights with Sales teams, adapting marketing strategies based on live feedback from customer interactions.
 • Ensure that all marketing efforts contribute directly to pipeline growth, deal acceleration, and revenue generation.
 
 Content Creation undamp; Messaging:
 • Own the end-to-end content development process, ensuring that our portfolio offerings are effectively translated into compelling, high-value content. Create engaging storytelling-driven assets, including case studies, thought leadership pieces, and campaign materials that support sales and drive engagement.
 
 Campaign Execution undamp; Optimization:
 • Lead ABM and lead generation campaigns across multiple channels, experimenting with innovative approaches like interactive content, video storytelling, and AI-driven personalization. Continuously analyze performance data to refine targeting and messaging.
 
 Lead Management undamp; Data-Driven Strategy:
 • Oversee lead tracking, scoring, and nurturing, ensuring smooth alignment between Marketing and Sales. Use data insights to optimize conversion and engagement strategies.
 
 Cross-Functional Collaboration undamp; Leadership:
 • Work closely with your team, regional marketing leaders, content creators, and global teams to ensure aligned messaging and impactful marketing execution. Foster a culture of creativity, strategic execution, and innovation.

            Qualifications
            • Degree in Marketing, Communications, Business Administration, or a related field.
 • Proven experience (5-8 yrs) in developing and implementing marketing strategies and campaigns, ideally in a B2B or software/technology environment.
 • Languages: Fluency in German undamp; English is required; proficiency in other European languages is a plus.
Requirements
 • Extensive experience in ABM undamp; lead generation, with a proven track record of developing and executing successful, sales-aligned marketing campaigns in a B2B or technology-driven environment.
 • Deep understanding of Business Development and Sales alignment, ensuring marketing efforts directly support pipeline growth and deal acceleration.
 • Proficiency in Salesforce for lead tracking and performance analysis, with strong data interpretation skills.
 • Strong content creation and messaging skills, with the ability to translate complex technical concepts into compelling, audience-specific content that drives engagement and conversions.
 • Strong collaboration and leadership abilities, with experience working cross-functionally with Sales, Product Management, and regional/global marketing teams.
 • Technical understanding of IT, software, or related industries is highly desirable.
 • Proactive, creative, and innovative mindset, with the ability to experiment with new marketing approaches and formats.

            Additional Information
            Why Join Us?
 This is an exciting opportunity to lead a transformative role in our marketing team. As Senior Account-Based undamp; Demand Generation Marketing Manager, you will shape how we engage with key accounts, driving meaningful business results and positioning the company as a leader in our industry. If you thrive on ownership, innovation, and making a tangible impact, we want to hear from you.

Willkommen bei Bosch
            Bei Bosch gestalten wir Zukunft mit hochwertigen Technologien und Dienstleistungen, die Begeisterung wecken und das Leben der Menschen verbessern. Unser Versprechen an unsere Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter steht dabei felsenfest: Wir wachsen gemeinsam, haben Freude an unserer Arbeit und inspirieren uns gegenseitig. Willkommen bei Bosch.
Die Bosch Thermotechnik GmbH freut sich auf eine Bewerbung!

            Job Description
            We are looking for an innovative and detail-oriented Business Process Manager (BPM) to focus on enabling BPM capabilities, creating frameworks for regular requirement and change management as well as planning and structuring discovery and Home Comfort (HC) SMART alignment phases for key transformation projects. This role is essential in shaping efficient workflows, fostering cross-functional collaboration, and laying the groundwork for successful digitization, transformation and roll-out execution.
- As a business process manager you establish and promote BPM frameworks as well as methodologies across the organization, develop and lead a BPM enablement program, including training, resources, and tools for stakeholders at all levels.
- You create and manage a Center of Excellence (CoE) to support BPM practitioners with best practices as well as guidance and foster a culture of continuous improvement, collaboration, and accountability in BPM practices.
- Furthermore, you design and implement a structured approach for regular requirement as well as change gathering, analysis, and prioritization across business units. You will collaborate with stakeholders to understand business needs and translate them into clear, actionable requirements.
- You develop templates, tools, and processes to streamline requirement documentation and validation and ensure alignment of requirements with business objectives and project outcomes.
- For conducting discovery (HC SMART alignment) phases in project lifecycles you define and implement best practices. You collaborate with project teams to structure discovery phases, including scope definition, stakeholder alignment, and resource allocation.
- You facilitate workshops and meetings to gather insights, identify risks, and establish a shared understanding of project goals and document as well as analyze findings from discovery phases to inform decision-making and project planning.
- In addition you develop and maintain governance structures to ensure consistency and scalability in BPM initiatives, track and report on BPM enablement, requirement management, and discovery phase metrics to measure success as well as identify opportunities for process optimization and implement improvements based on data-driven insights.
- Act as a bridge between business units, IT, and project management teams to ensure alignment on BPM initiatives. You partner with leadership to prioritize projects and align discovery efforts with strategic objectives and provide guidance as well as support to cross-functional teams during the requirement gathering and discovery phases.

            Qualifications
            - Education: university degree (preferred master) in the field of Business Administration, Industrial Engineering, Operations Management, or related field
- Experience and Knowledge: several years of experience in in BPM, requirement management, or project discovery phases; proven experience in enabling BPM practices within a complex organizational environment; proficiency in BPM tools and methodologies (e.g., BPMN, Signavio); familiarity with process intelligence platforms (e.g., Celonis, Process Mining,...) and with tools for requirement management and discovery documentation (e.g., JIRA, Confluence); strong analytical and data visualization skills using tools like Power BI or Tableau, knowledge of ERP systems and their integration into BPM initiatives
- Personality and Working Practice: exceptional problem-solving and critical-thinking skills, strong leadership and communication abilities, with a focus on stakeholder engagement and a highly organized and detail-oriented working practice with the ability to manage multiple priorities

            Additional Information
            Diversity and inclusion are not just trends for us but are firmly anchored in our corporate culture. Therefore, we welcome all applications, regardless of gender, age, disability, religion, ethnic origin or sexual identity.

We are seeking a highly skilled and detail-oriented Cybersecurity Data Firewall Specialist to join our cybersecurity team.  The ideal candidate will have expertise in data firewall technologies, with a strong focus on IBM Guardium and Oracle Advanced Security tools such as Oracle Key Vault.  This role is essential in ensuring the security, integrity, and compliance of sensitive data across critical enterprise systems.

Your Responsibilities:
* Implement, maintain, and optimize IBM Guardium and Oracle Vault to protect sensitive data from unauthorized access
* Regularly monitor data access patterns and firewall logs to identify suspicious activities
* Develop and enforce security policies while collaborating with compliance teams to ensure adherence to regulations such as GDPR and HIPAA
* Investigate security incidents and work closely with IT teams to resolve vulnerabilities and mitigate risks
* Integrate security solutions into other systems and collaborate with various IT departments to ensure a secure architecture
* Create documentation for security configurations, incident reports, and provide regular updates to stakeholders

Your Profile:
* In-depth knowledge of IBM Guardium and Oracle Key Vault
* Experience with relational databases such as Oracle, SQL Server, and MySQL
* Strong understanding of data security principles, including encryption, access control, and auditing
* Experience with compliance requirements such as GDPR, HIPAA, and PCI-DSS
* Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills
* Strong communication skills to convey complex security concepts clearly and understandably

We offer:
* Attractive additonal financial benefits such as holiday allowances and health bonus
* Allowance for company pension schemes and income protection
* Individual development through the Mühlbauer Academy with internal and external training measures
* Employee events (e.g. Christmas party, folk festival visit and barbecue)
* International working environment - opportunities for temporary assignments abroad
* At the location in Roding, you can also expect: Reasonably priced meals in the company's internal cafeteria, company owned fitnessstudio (free entrance for employees)
* Many more benefits can be found on our homepage

Have we raised your interest? 
Then we look forward to receiving your application!

Die **Brandenburgische Technische Universität Cottbus–Senftenberg (BTU)** ist eine junge aufstrebende Universität und die einzige Technische Universität des Landes Brandenburg. Mit mehr als 1.500 Beschäftigten ist die BTU einer der größten Arbeitgeber in der Lausitz und kann hier vor allem durch ihre Vereinbarkeit von Beruf und Familie überzeugen.

In der **Fakultät MINT – Mathematik, Informatik, Physik, Elektro- und Informationstechnik** ist im **Fachgebiet Datenbank- und Informationssysteme** in Cottbus folgende Stelle zum nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt zu besetzen:

                                                                 **IT-Systemadministrator*in (m/w/d)**

unbefristet, Vollzeit, Entgeltgruppe 11 TV-L,

**Kennziffer: 59/25**
**** 
Das Fachgebiet Datenbank- und Informationssysteme beschäftigt sich in Forschung und Lehre mit Architekturen, Konzepten, Algorithmen und Datenstrukturen von Datenbank- und Informationssystemen.

**Das sind Ihre Aufgaben**:

- Konzeption, Beschaffung und Betreuung von Soft- und Hardware für Datenhaltungs- und Datenbanksysteme für Lehre und Forschung
- Vorbereiten und Betreuen von IT-Systemen für Forschungs- und Industrieprojekten des Fachgebiets, insbesondere Administrieren der projektbezogenen Systeme
- Beratung und Betreuung der wissenschaftlichen Mitarbeiter*innen des Fachgebiets in Bezug auf Beschaffung und Nutzung technischer IT-Systeme Betreuung des Labors des Fachgebiets, der Netzwerk-, der Scan- und der Druckertechnik
- Betreuung des Rechnerlabors, der Netzwerk-, Backup-, Scan-, Video- und der Druckertechnik des Fachgebiets
- Koordinierung und Unterstützung bei der Beschaffung und Betreuung technischer Systeme des Instituts für Informatik

**Voraussetzungen:**
Sie verfügen über ein erfolgreich abgeschlossenes Hochschulstudium (Bachelor/ FH-Diplom) im Bereich der Informatik mit dem Schwerpunkt Praktische oder Technische Informatik oder ähnlich geeigneter Fachrichtung oder vergleichbare Fähigkeiten und Erfahrungen

Folgende Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen bringen Sie mit:

- gute Kenntnisse des Aufbaus und der Funktionsweise von Datenbanksystemen und über die Befähigung zur Konzeption und Administration (Datenbankadministrator*in).
- Kenntnisse und Erfahrungen in der Betreuung von Hochleistungssystemen und Massenspeichersystemen (Big Data) für KI-Anwendungen
- Befähigung zur Administration von IT-Systemen allgemein (Systemprogrammierung, Betriebssystem, Netzwerk-, Backup, Scan-, Video-, Audio- und Druckertechnik) sowie Konfiguration und Reparatur von Hardware (etwa Netzteilumtausch und Lötarbeiten an Platinen)
- Erfahrung bei der Beschaffung von IT-Technik und IT-Systemen
- Sprachkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift in Deutsch und Englisch (mindestens B2)

Persönlich zeichnen Sie sich durch eine systematische Arbeitsweise und ausgeprägte analytische Fähigkeiten zur Erfassung, Bewertung und Entscheidung komplexer Sachverhalte aus. Ihr hohes Maß an Verantwortungsbewusstsein und Dienstleistungsorientierung und Ihr analytisches und lösungsorientiertes Denkvermögen sowie Ihr Organisationsgeschick tragen nachweislich zum Arbeitserfolg bei. Eine hervorragende Team- und Kooperationsfähigkeit sowie Initiative und Einsatzbereitschaft und eine ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit runden Ihr Profil ab.

Für weitere Informationen über die zu besetzende Stelle steht Ihnen Prof. Dr.-Ing. habil. Ingo Schmitt (E-Mail: [schmitt@b-tu.de](https://mailto:schmitt@b-tu.de), Tel.: +49 (0)355 / 69-2039) sehr gerne zur Verfügung.

**Das bieten wir Ihnen:**

Wir bieten Ihnen eine Beschäftigung nach dem Tarifvertrag der Länder. Unsere Mitarbeiter*innen profitieren von flexiblen Arbeitszeiten, Erholungsurlaub nach TV-L, verschiedenen internen und externen Weiterbildungsangeboten sowie einem aktiven Gesundheitsmanagement.

Werden Sie ein Teil der BTU- Familie. Wir freuen uns auf Ihre Bewerbung und bieten Ihnen abwechslungsreiche Aufgaben mit hohem Entwicklungs- und Gestaltungspotenzial
 
Die BTU Cottbus-Senftenberg engagiert sich für Chancengleichheit und Diversität
und strebt in allen Beschäftigtengruppen eine ausgewogene Geschlechterrelation
an. Personen mit einer Schwerbehinderung sowie diesen Gleichgestellte werden
bei gleicher Eignung vorrangig berücksichtigt.

Auf die Vorlage von Bewerbungsfotos wird verzichtet.

Bitte beachten Sie die näheren [Hinweise zum Auswahlverfahren](https://www-docs.b-tu.de/verwaltung/public/stellen/Hinweise_zum_Auswahlverfahren.pdf) auf der Internetseite der BTU.

Ihre Bewerbungsunterlagen in **einem PDF-Dokument** richten Sie bitte **unter Angabe der Kennziffer ausschließlich per E-Mail** bis zum **23.05.2025** an den **Dekan der Fakultät 1 MINT - Mathematik, Informatik, Physik, Elektro- und Informationstechnik,** Brandenburgische Technische Universität Cottbus-Senftenberg, **E-Mail:** [fakultaet1+bewerbungen@b-tu.de](https://mailto:fakultaet1+bewerbungen@b-tu.de).

## Unternehmensbeschreibung

Continental entwickelt wegweisende Technologien und Dienste für die nachhaltige und vernetzte Mobilität der Menschen und ihrer Güter. Das 1871 gegründete Technologieunternehmen bietet sichere, effiziente, intelligente und erschwingliche Lösungen für Fahrzeuge, Maschinen, Verkehr und Transport. Continental erzielte 2023 einen Umsatz von 41,4 Milliarden Euro und beschäftigt aktuell rund 200.000 Mitarbeiterinnen und Mitarbeiter in 56 Ländern und Märkten.

## Stellenbeschreibung

Hey, du bist auf der Suche nach einem spannenden Referendariat in der Anwalts- oder Wahlstation, bei dem du wertvolle Einblicke in unsere Data Compliance Abteilung gewinnen kannst? Dann haben wir genau das Richtige für dich!

Für das **Jahr 2025** suchen wir dich zur Unterstützung unserer Rechtsabteilung. Wir werden dich im Rahmen dieser Tätigkeit **vor Ort in Hannover** brauchen.

Du arbeitest mit einem hohen Maß an Eigenverantwortung an relevanten Fragestellungen und in Projekten aus Bereichen des Datenschutzrechts und sammelst so in einem globalen Umfeld wertvolle Praxiserfahrung in deiner Anwalts- oder Wahlstation. Durch die Teilnahme an Beratungsgesprächen mit internen Mandanten, Vertragsverhandlungen und Teambesprechungen erhältst du fundierte Einblicke in die Arbeitsweise der Datenschutzabteilung eines weltweit agierenden DAX-Konzerns und bist Teil eines engagierten internationalen Teams.

Was erwartet dich bei uns:

- Bearbeite konkrete, praxisrelevanten Anfragen aus den weltweiten Fachabteilungen in deutscher und englischer Sprache
- Prüfe und bewerte eigenständig vielseitige, aktuelle Sachverhalts- und Rechtsfragen
- Erarbeite Lösungswegen und recherchiere zur Erstellung von Rechtsgutachten
- Du unterstützt uns bei der Erstellung und Verhandlung von Verträgen aller Art
- Arbeite aktiv mit an diversen aktuellen internationalen Projekten

## Qualifikationen

Du fragst dich, ob du für das Referendariat in unserer Rechtsabteilung geeignet bist? Hier sind wichtige Qualifikationen, die wir suchen:

- Du verfügst über das erste juristische Staatsexamen mit Interessenschwerpunkt im IT- & Datenschutzrecht, damit du grundlegende Aspekte unseres Aufgabenbereichs mitbringst
- Du solltest mit MS Office vertraut sein und gute Kenntnisse in den gängigen Programmen mitbringen
- Fließende Deutsch- und Englischkenntnisse in Wort und Schrift sind für uns unbedingt notwendig

Neben diesen fachlichen Anforderungen suchen wir aber auch nach bestimmten Eigenschaften und Fähigkeiten:

- Du bist eine Person mit hoher Einsatzbereitschaft und Eigeninitiative und kannst dich für viele Themen begeistern
- Analytisches Denken und ein Verständnis für wirtschaftliche Zusammenhänge sind notwendig und helfen dir, die Aufgaben effektiv zu lösen
- Eine sehr gut ausgeprägte Kommunikationsfähigkeit und Teamfähigkeit sind für uns besonders wichtig - schließlich müssen wir immer gemeinsam an Lösungen arbeiten

Bevor du deine Bewerbung abschickst, gibt es noch ein paar Dinge, an die du denken solltest: Wir benötigen deinen aktuellen Notenspiegel bzw. das erste juristische Staatsexamen, um deine Bewerbung bearbeiten zu können.

Wenn du nicht aus dem EU-Raum kommst, sende uns auch bitte deinen gültigen Aufenthaltstitel und deine Arbeitsgenehmigung inklusive Zusatzblatt zu.

Die Bewerbungen von schwerbehinderten Menschen sind willkommen.

## Zusätzliche Informationen

- Wir bieten dir **flexible Arbeitszeiten** mit hybriden Arbeitsmodellen, bei denen du die Möglichkeit hast, gelegentlich auch von zu Hause aus zuarbeiten, denn wir wissen, wie wichtig das Zusammenspiel von Privat- und Berufsleben ist
- Du wirst von unseren **erfahrenen Fachkräften** qualifiziert betreut, um dein fachliches Wissen und deine praktischen Fähigkeiten zu verbessern
- Profitiere von einer Vielzahl an Rabatten und Ermäßigungen über unsere **Corporate Benefits** für verschiedene Marken, von Mode bis hin zu Freizeitaktivitäten oder Technikprodukten
- Unser Standort ist zentral gelegen in der Nähe des Hannover Hauptbahnhofs und verfügt über **ein werkseigenes Parkhaus** zur kostenfreien Nutzung
- Als Mitarbeiterin oder Mitarbeiter hast du außerdem die Möglichkeit, ermäßigte Speisen in unserer **werkseigenen Kantine** zu genießen

Wenn du dich in unserer Stelle wiederfindest und Lust hast, mit uns an spannenden Projekten zu arbeiten, dann bewirb dich jetzt und werde Teil unseres Teams!

[Vielfalt, Inklusion und Zugehörigkeit](https://www.continental.com/de/karriere/arbeiten-bei-continental/ihr-arbeitgeber/diversity/) sind uns wichtig und machen uns als Unternehmen stark und erfolgreich. Wir bieten allen Chancengleichheit – unabhängig von Alter, Geschlecht, Nationalität, kultureller Herkunft, Behinderung, Religion, Weltanschauung oder sexueller Orientierung.

Sie wollen mit uns Gas geben? Starten Sie durch und bewerben Sie sich jetzt!

column5: OESL IT Data Analyst (m/f/d) BA OESL - REF76565G
column6:
## Company Description

Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent, and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2023, Continental generated sales of €41.4 billion and currently employs around 200,000 people in 56 countries and markets.

Guided by the vision of being the customer's first choice for material-driven solutions, the ContiTech group sector focuses on development competence and material expertise for products and systems made of rubber, plastics, metal, and fabrics. These can also be equipped with electronic components in order to optimize them functionally for individual services. ContiTech's industrial growth areas are primarily in the areas of energy, agriculture, construction, and surfaces. In addition, ContiTech serves the automotive and transportation industries as well as rail transport.

## Job Description

**Data Driven Applications**

- Design, implement and maintain data products based on business requirements.
- Apply domain specific knowledge to derive business insights from data.
- Be a part of OESL’s data strategy, supporting our business and IT stakeholders in gaining data driven insights.
- Work with cutting-edge data warehousing technologies, tools, and services to shape the future of OESL's data driven decision making capabilities.

**Implementation and Optimization**

- Implement and maintain IT-managed reporting use cases end-to-end (from data curation to report creation).
- Continuously support business and IT stakeholders in gaining data driven insights.
- Act as a trusted advisor supporting users of our data products with your expertise.

**Governance and Compliance**

- Ensure data usage is compliant and in line with relevant policies and regulations (e.g. GDPR)

**Collaboration and Stakeholder Engagement**

- Collaborate with business and IT stakeholders to foster strong partnerships in the domain of data warehousing and reporting.

Hiring can take place at different OESL IT Locations 

## Qualifications

We’re seeking a skilled **Data Analyst** to implement and maintain our Data Driven Applications and Data Products. Key skills and expertise include:

- **Data Analysis:** Highly motivated to understand data from different sources and domains, work on harmonization and common reporting strategies.
- **Communication:** Benefit from your strong communication skills and collaborative attitude when working in cross-functional teams.
- **Data Driven Applications:** Experience with design, setup and operation of reporting use-cases (e.g. based on Power BI) or data processing pipelines.
- **Data Governance & Security**: Familiarity with central regulations (e.g. GDPR) and common data governance approaches.
- **Agile and DevOps**: Knowledge of collaborative workflows and modern deployment practices.

Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.

## Additional Information

The well-being of our employees is important to us. That's why we offer exciting career prospects and support you in achieving a good work-life balance with additional benefits such as:

- Training opportunities
- Mobile and flexible working models
- Sabbaticals
- and much more...

Sounds interesting for you? [Click here to find out more.](https://www.continental.com/en/career/working-at-continental/benefits/)

#Jobdrehscheibe

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

column5: R&D Digital Business Processes Developer Material and Technology (m/f/d) - REF58227W
column6:
## Company Description

Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent, and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2023, Continental generated sales of €41.4 billion and currently employs around 200,000 people in 56 countries and markets.

Guided by the vision of being the customer's first choice for material-driven solutions, the ContiTech group sector focuses on development competence and material expertise for products and systems made of rubber, plastics, metal and fabrics. These can also be equipped with electronic components in order to optimize them functionally for individual services. ContiTech's industrial growth areas are primarily in the areas of energy, agriculture, construction and surfaces. In addition, ContiTech serves the automotive and transportation industries as well as rail transport.

## Job Description

**OESL – Original Equipment Solutions, For Future Mobility.**

Are you ready to move *ForwardTogether* with a global, dedicated and experienced team? 

Join us and take the opportunity to contribute to our future in the fundamentally changing automotive industry with your new role as R&D Digital Business Processes Developer Material and Technology (m/f/diverse) in the stand-alone Business Area Original Equipment Solutions.

**About Original Equipment Solutions:**

With more than 17.000 employees and around 2bn€ sales, present in 15 countries with 35 locations and tech centers – OESL is a global player in the automotive sector with extended material competence in rubber, plastic and metal, serving all major OEM’s and commercial vehicle customers’ needs with millions of parts in high quality.

We are looking for you to support our Business Area Original Equipment Solutions at the location Hann. Münden. You are responsible to develop and improve our R&D business processes and strongly support the digitalization with coding to increase efficiency and transparency. You enable the systematic collection of process and material data through our global R&D technology areas and drive the automatization of data collection. You act as a key user for the material database management, which includes for example the recipe and chemical management. In your role, you work with internal and external service providers and support the implementation of AI methodology in the R&D material and technology area.

Your role will include the following tasks:

- Digitalization of processes and enhancing existing processes (including problem solving and debugging)
- Key User for R&D recipe and material data management tool (ChemRemSy) ​
- Enable systematic collection and analyis of process data through R&D technology areas​
- Setup and build-up of a central material database management​
- Leading R&D IT projects and work with external software providers
- Working with developing databases like SQL, MongoDB, Influx
- Design complex database querys for later analysis
- Data refinement, processing and analysis with visualization, e.g material portfolio
- Support the implementation of AI methodology in the material and technology area

## Qualifications

- Academic degree in computer science, economics or an equivalent qualification
- Several years of experience with software development and coding
- Advanced knowledge in software development (e.g. Python)
- Advanced knowledge no and low-code applications (especially Forms, Flow, PowerAutomate, Mendix, Ignition)
- Experienced in databases like SQL (MySQL, MariaDB, MongoDB, Influx)
- Experienced in Data Analytics
- Experienced in project management
- Advanced knowledge of Office365 (especially Word, Excel, Teams, SharePoints)
- Business proficient English and basic German language skills  written and spoken
- Excellent communication skills
- Working experience within intercultural and global teams is desirable

Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.

## Additional Information

The well-being of our employees is important to us. That's why we offer exciting career prospects and support you in achieving a good work-life balance with additional benefits such as:​

- Training opportunities​
- Mobile and flexible working models​
- Sabbaticals​
- and much more...​

Sounds interesting for you? [Click here to find ](https://www.continental.com/en/career/working-at-continental/benefits/)[out more.](https://www.continental.com/en/career/working-at-continental/benefits/)

[Diversity, Inclusion & Belonging](https://www.continental.com/en/career/working-at-continental/corporate-culture-values/diversity/) are important to us and make our company strong and successful. We offer equal opportunities to everyone - regardless of age, gender, nationality, cultural background, disability, religion, ideology or sexual orientation. 

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

column5: (Senior) IT Auditor - Internal Audit Tires (m/f/d) - REF79908C
column6:
## Company Description

*Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2023, Continental generated sales of €41.4 billion and currently employs around 200,000 people in 56 countries and markets.*

## Job Description

Join our IT Audit Team and analyze complex IT systems, processes and organizations worldwide. Identify risks in core processes and systems and add value to the whole organization. Broaden your horizons and actively shape the development of a state-of-the-art IT Audit team.
The IT audit areas include IT security, IT infrastructure, IT governance, IT service management and processes in IT operations, IT risk management, complex data analyses, internal control processes as well as ERP systems and other relevant applications.

These will be your tasks and responsibilities in detail:

- Analysis and assessment of IT-supported business processes regarding effectiveness, efficiency, quality, potential risks as well as compliance with regulatory and internal requirements
- Evaluation of the security of IT-infrastructure, systems, and applications through vulnerability analysis
- Prepare fieldwork, conduct interviews, evaluate IT processes, and conduct analysis in the systems
- Observe compliance with standards / policies and procedures, compile findings, propose recommendations, and ensure documentation
- Update the Audit Management System and present findings in English to management
- Consult management in the development and improvement of internal IT processes as well as systems and monitor the implementation of recommendations
- Participate in general audits and fraud investigations
- Development of risk-oriented audit programs in the IT audit areas including tools concerning data analytics and automation e.g., with Knime and Python

## Qualifications

- Academic degree in Business Informatics, IT, Engineering, or Business Administration
- Several years of professional experience as internal IT auditor or other IT areas such as IT security, IT consulting or IT infrastructure
- Ideally audit-specific certifications such as CISA, CISM or CRISC from ISACA
- Comprehensive knowledge in IT project management, IT security, software development, IT service management, IT infrastructure, IT governance and risk management
- Comprehensive knowledge of the common IT frameworks and guidelines (e.g. COBIT, ITIL, ISO 2700x, NIS2, BSI standards)
- Business-fluent English language skills (written and spoken); additional languages advantageous
- Enhanced analytical skills and professional judgement
- Self-confident appearance and professional presentation skills
- Advanced team and communication skills
- Willingness for international business trips (30 - 50 %)

Applications from severely disabled people are welcome.

## Additional Information

What We Offer: 

- Exciting and diversified projects
- An inside in innovative technologies of the automotive industry
- Wide network to research and development parties
- Modern leadership culture
- Individual choice of working times
- Promotion of personal development
- Participation in the company’s success

We are committed to fostering a workplace where everyone feels safe, respected, and valued. We encourage applications from all qualified candidates regardless of age, gender, nationality, cultural background, disability, religion, ideology or sexual orientation.

If you meet the requirements, you will be contacted within 15 days.

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.

column5: HR IT Engineer Architecture & Integration (m/f/diverse) - REF75166S
column6:
## Company Description

Continental develops pioneering technologies and services for sustainable and connected mobility of people and their goods. Founded in 1871, the technology company offers safe, efficient, intelligent and affordable solutions for vehicles, machines, traffic and transportation. In 2022, Continental generated sales of €39.4 billion and currently employs around 200,000 people in 57 countries and markets.

The Automotive group sector comprises technologies for passive safety, brake, chassis, motion and motion control systems. Innovative solutions for assisted and automated driving, display and operating technologies, as well as audio and camera solutions for the vehicle interior, are also part of the portfolio, as is intelligent information and communication technology for the mobility services of fleet operators and commercial vehicle manufacturers. Comprehensive activities relating to connectivity technologies, vehicle electronics and high-performance computers round off the range of products and services.

## Job Description

We are seeking an experienced HR IT Engineer to serve as an Enterprise Architect with a focus on SAP and full-stack architecture, integration, and implementation. The successful candidate will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining the overall architecture of our HR IT landscape, with a focus on SAP HCM, as well as SAP SuccessFactors. This role will work closely with HR, IT, and other stakeholders to ensure seamless integration and utilization of the system.

**Key Responsibilities:**

- Developing and Implementing Release Management and Migration Strategies for HR IT SAP system landscape (Cloud, Hybrid and onPrem )
- Consulting on Business Transformation, Transition and Target Architecture Management
- System and Process Monitoring
- Developing and maintaining a deep understanding of SAP Cloud Platform, including SAP Cloud Foundry, SAP Cloud Platform Integration, and SAP Cloud Platform API Management.
- Governance of our Landscape via IT System and Process Monitoring
- Stay up-to-date with the latest trends and developments in HR IT
- Ensuring Second Line of Defense with compliant system landscape and architecture
- Collaborating with cross-functional teams to design and implement HR IT infrastructure
- Providing technical leadership and guidance to junior team members
- Responsibility for managing external service providers

The position can be staffed in either Frankfurt, Regensburg or Hannover. 

## Qualifications

- Academic Degree in IT or comparable qualification
- Several years of professional experience in IT Management
- Profound Knowledge in IT Enterprise Architecture for SAP HCM with SAP onPrem and SAP Cloud
- Know-How on Platform Architecture
- Sound knowledge of SAP HCM, SuccessFactors and the relevant SAP cloud and on-premise solutions
- Understanding of enterprise architecture frameworks (e.g. TOGAF, Zachman) and their application in practice
- Knowledge of middleware technologies and APIs (e.g. REST, SOAP)
- Understanding of security protocols, authentication mechanisms and data protection requirements
- Experience with SAP integration platforms (e.g. SAP PI/PO, SAP Cloud Platform Integration
- Strong analytical skills and innovative thinking
- Ability to deliver complex technical concepts 
- Strong negotiation skills and profound communication skills

Applications from severely handicapped people are welcome.

## Additional Information

**Your vision is ambitious. Just like ours.**

As HR IT department, we take pride in delivering innovative IT solutions that support every stage of the employee lifecycle. Our global operations and projects are diverse, exciting, and filled with opportunities to make a real impact. What truly sets us apart, however, is our exceptional team spirit. We are driven by a shared passion for excellence, striving for shared success, built on trust, mutual support, and the freedom to take initiative. Together, we celebrate our achievements and continuously push boundaries to create impactful solutions.

The well-being of our employees is important to us. That's why we offer exciting career prospects and support you in achieving a good work-life balance with additional benefits such as:

- Training opportunities
- Mobile and flexible working models
- Sabbaticals
- and much more...

Sounds interesting for you? [Click here to find out more.](https://www.continental.com/en/career/working-at-continental/benefits/)

You are looking for an individual working time model? We support part-time work.

You would like to learn more about our additional services? [Click here. ](https://www.continental.com/en/career/working-at-continental/what-we-offer/)

Ready to drive with Continental? Take the first step and fill in the online application.
